title: Type inference for function-traits is different from other traits if an argument is a reference
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

### I tried this code:

```rust
pub struct Hello<F>(F);

// The error is fixed by adding a bound here:
// F: Fn(&mut ())
impl<F> Hello<F> {
    pub fn new(f: F) -> Self {
        Self(f)
    }
}

impl<F: Fn(&mut ())> Hello<F> {
    pub fn hello(&self) {}
}

fn main() {
    Hello::new(|_| ()).hello();
}
```
(does not work with `Fn`, `FnMut` or `FnOnce`)

### I expected to see this happen:

It should have compiled, because for example the following compiles:
```rust
use core::fmt;

pub struct Hello<F>(F);

impl<F> Hello<F> {
    pub fn new(f: F) -> Self {
        Self(f)
    }
}

impl<F: fmt::Display> Hello<F> {
    pub fn hello(&self) {}
}

fn main() {
    Hello::new("").hello();
}
```

### Instead, this happened:
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0599]: the method `hello` exists for struct `Hello<[closure@src/main.rs:16:16: 16:22]>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:16:24
   |
1  | pub struct Hello<F>(F);
   | ----------------------- method `hello` not found for this
...
16 |     Hello::new(|_| ()).hello();
   |                ------  ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `Hello<[closure@src/main.rs:16:16: 16:22]>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
   |                |
   |                doesn't satisfy `<_ as FnOnce<(&mut (),)>>::Output = ()`
   |                doesn't satisfy `_: Fn<(&mut (),)>`
   |
   = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
           `<[closure@src/main.rs:16:16: 16:22] as FnOnce<(&mut (),)>>::Output = ()`
           `[closure@src/main.rs:16:16: 16:22]: Fn<(&mut (),)>`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.52.1 (9bc8c42bb 2021-05-09)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53
commit-date: 2021-05-09
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.52.1
LLVM version: 12.0.0
```

This bug exists in nightly, beta and stable.
